page.title: 02LONG ASHTON BY-PASS
page.content: The Long Ashton by-pass is a fast, direct road. It leads to the centre of Bristol from the village of Flax Bourton, and was built in 1969. The village of Long Ashton is now much safer and less busy. During the rush-hour, before the by-pass was built, traffic queues stretched out from Bristol city centre, through Long Ashton , to Nailsea, a distance of seven or eight miles. If you had to travel through Long Ashton, you had to allow an extra half hour because the traffic was so bad. There were many accidents because of the traffic jams.There were many more accidents than now on the main road at the western end of the village, involving children being knocked down on their way to school.
